Package sample

Class AppointmentsController

  • java.lang.Object
    • sample.AppointmentsController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class AppointmentsController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class handles the AppointmentsController which is primary the viewing/holding Scene for adding, editing, deleting, and viewing Appointments. This scene houses the TableView for all of the appointments, and has buttons which direct the user to the creation/updating stage of the program.

      • deleteAppointment

        public void deleteAppointment​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                       throws java.sql.SQLException,
                              java.lang.NullPointerException,
                              java.io.IOException
        This method handles the deletion of appointments if conditions are met. Firstly, something must be selected before it can be deleted. Then a confirmation is sent to the user. If the user accepts the record is deleted, and the user is notified of the successful deletion.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        java.lang.NullPointerException
        java.io.IOException

      • goToAddAppointments

        public void goToAddAppointments​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)

        This method sends the user to the AddAppointment Scene.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • goToEditAppointments

        public void goToEditAppointments​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        This method sends the user to the AddAppointment Scene if a valid row is selected. Also, Main.editData stores the value of the row based on the appointmentId Column.
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • connect

        private void connect()
              throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method queries everything from appointments and creates a new Appointments object (See Appointments for more details). Then, the TableView is given these values for the user to see.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • changeTimeZone

        private java.lang.String changeTimeZone​(java.sql.Timestamp ts)
        This method handles showing the user the date time in their system locale in 12 hour format. While the data is in the database as 24 hour UTC, for viewing purposes it gets re-converted back to 12 hour AM/PM time based on the user's zoneId.
        Parameters:
        ts - (TimeStamp)
        Returns:
        convertedLdt.format(dtf) convertedLocalDateTime formatted.

      • setColumns

        private void setColumns()
        Simple method to set TableColumns' CellValueFactories. This method is used to keep initialize cleaner.

      • minimize

        public void minimize()
        This Method simply minimizes the program if the minimize label is pressed.

      • exitTheProgram

        public void exitTheProgram()
        This method exits the program if the x button is pressed.
